----PRIVATE KEY----

In the private key file, I can expect to see the version and several numbers that represent the modulus, public and private exponents, two prime numbers, d mod (prime-1) for both prime numbers, the CRT coefficient, and for each of those, the value type and size. 

Taking off the header and ending that has begin or end rsa private key, I copy/pasted the key into the decoder. 

The first integer is the version with value 0x00 or just 0. The offset is 4 with DER encoding 02.

The second integer is the modulus with value . The offset is 7 with DER encoding 02.

The third integer is the public rsa exponent with value 0x010001. The offset is 396 with DER encoding 02.

The fourth integer is the private rsa exponent d with value . The offset is 401 with DER encoding 02.

The fifth integer is the first prime factor p of the modulus with value . The offset is 789 with DER encoding 02.

The sixth integer is the second prime factor q of the modulus with value . The offset is 985 with DER encoding 02.

The seventh integer is d mod (p-1) with value . The offset is 1181 with DER encoding 02.

The eigth integer is d mod (q-1) with value . THe offset is 1377 with DER encoding 02.

The ninth and final integer is the CRT coefficient q^(-1) mod p with value . THe offset is 1572 with eDER encoding 02.

----PUBLIC KEY----

In the public key, I should find the text "ssh-rsa", the public rsa exponent, the modulus, and the sizes of each of these. I decoded using base 64 and hexdump.

The first value is 7 bytes that correspond to the ASCII of "ssh-rsa". 
The second value is 3 bytes corresponding to the public rsa exponent of 0x010001, the same as the one from the private key.
The third value is 385 bytes corresponding to the modulus of , the same as the one from the private key.


----SANITY CHECK----

I've checked and confirmed the several relationships that the given numbers should have in the python code named "sanity" in the same directory.
